title: Cafe Hood
address: Montalvo &, Baños de Agua Santa 180250, Ecuador
comment: Great place, relaxed enviroment with tasty food

title: Luna Runtun
comment: This restaurant has great food and an excelent view

title: Delicias Cuencanas, Shopping
comment: Very rustic and cozy, they serve typical ecuadorian food, shopping

title: 59 Rivoli
comment: A quirky art gallery with free entry that features over 30 artists in residence. It was created by sqatters (les artistes squatteurs) in 1999 and after a lot of hard work, the gallery officially reopened in 2009 (L'AFTERSQUAT) and artists are now legally allowed to occupy the space to showcase their work.

title: Three Seven Paris
comment: Beautiful tableware and decorative objects that are all made and illustated locally, by hand in their workshop

title: Marché des Enfants Rouges
comment: I absolutely loved my time in this relatively small but quaint marché, where we bought ham, cheese, ate some crepe and also has an absolutely amazing Italian stall that served us amazing Italian food.

title: Patati Patata
comment: Small hole in the wall that serves esclusively baked potatoes, smothered in whatever topping combination you order. The staff is so welcoming- its like a diamond in a hay stack

title: Chez Alain Miam Miam
comment: Alain spends his days spreading butter on cast iron plates, pouring batter over the heat, and loading up his crepes and galettes with all-organic produce. And there is no shortage of it. His crepes and galettes are huge—big enough for two—and bursting with flavor. In addition to the stall at the Marché des Enfants Rouge, Alain also has his own café just around the corner at 26 Rue Charlot

title: Make My Lemonade
comment: A beauty! The small café at the back of the store gives a plus to the concept store as well as the brands in collaboration. Each corner is carefully decorated, the harmony of the colors is very pleasant, the distribution of the shop and the haberdashery, simply, top of the top, creative and original. I'm a fan!

title: Twins Concept Store
comment: Super concept store in which you will find lots of gift ideas. The 2 twin brothers are super nice, very welcoming. It feels like home.

title: Garage Claude Porte Doree
address: 4 Rue du Colonel Oudot, 75012 Paris, Île-de-France
comment: Extremely professional, a warm welcome and a contained price, it's really the small old-fashioned Parisian garage that gives priority to customers.

title: Cordonnerie A La Ville A La Montagne
comment: Best shoe repair you can find. The staff is extremely knowledgeable and very friendly

title: Pura Vida Worldly Art
comment: Absolutely love this shop. Pricey but fair trade so you feel good getting it and supporting it!!. Useful items made all over the world. I got a gorgeous singing bowl here for my sister and it is stunning to look at and listen to. I love everything that carry here.

title: Woo Skincare + Cosmetics
comment: Fabulous staff (Ann is amazing!) and the best product offerings - from skin to jewelry and everything in between.

title: Thread Florals
comment: An amazing floral designer specializing in large events and botanical installations. The owner has a unique style that is evident in her work!

title: Pasta & Provisions
comment: I've been a fan of Pasta Provisions for several years now. Their locations have a rustic, almost boutique feel about them and create a warm feel when shopping there. The food is fantastic and the products are fantastic.

title: Maison by Kim Mauney
comment: What a sophisticated retail experience! At Maison, you will find North Carolina-made furniture, antiques, home decor goods, and gifts galore.

title: Swiss Watch Repair
address: 2101 Sardis Rd N Suite 217, Charlotte, NC 28227
comment: Matt and his father are very professional and knowledgeable men. They work with watch of all sizes. Reasonable prices. I would not go anywhere else!

title: Neighborhood Theatre
comment: Great local neighborhood music venue. They get a wide range of national acts. They have a wide range of local beers, and great restaurants are all within a stones throw.

title: Visulite Theatre
comment: Favorite place in Charlotte to listen to live music. Small, quaint place and the atmosphere is the best.

title: Cellarest Beer Project
comment: Best beer in West. I remember the first 4, but I have been told I really enjoyed the next 5!

title: The Whale
comment: The owners have an appreciation for beers and wines from all over the world and they like to share. CHekc this place out for an ultra chill hang spot with friends.

title: W.A.L.K.
comment: Great mix of bar food and southern delights

title: HomeGrown
comment: Always a go-to for some soul touching crunch! Classic dishes and relaxing atmosphere at a good price.

title: The Grey Eagle
comment: Best mid-sized music venue in town, eat a taco while you are there!

title: Mark Bettis Gallery
comment: One of the many great galleries in the River Arts District. These local artists have really done it right!

title: Salvage Station
comment: This venue is nestled next to the great French Broad River and it slapssss!!!! I got crunch on the tunes and drunk on the booze. Come catch a show in the scary part of the RAD!!

title: Asheville Music Hall
comment: Music Hall is kind of misnomer for this stellar bastion of badassery here right in downtown A-ville, there is music most nights but every weekend there is art shows and local gatherings too!! All art is welcome and awesome.

title: Malaprop's Bookstore
comment: Such a cute little book shop! Their selection is broad and focuses mostly on topics hard to find in your big box store. Check it out!

title: Gamers' Haunt
comment: This is THE PLACE for anyone who takes gaming seriously. All the games you need, dice and books galore! I go to the weekly gaming nights, definitely a nat 20.

title: Musician's Workshop, Inc.®
comment: These guys rock, get your gear here!

title: Grove Arcade
comment: A repurposed building for neat shops and stalls. There are so many artisenal goods and arts that I didn't ever want to leave!

title: Heyday Musical Instruments & Repair
comment: Gear fix. All electric instruments and amplifiers. Get new tubes and a rewire on your pedals.

title: Doulas of Asheville, LLC
comment: When my wife and I discovered we were pregnant again, we really wanted to go another route than jsut the hospital medical pushiness. To avoid the cascade of intervention that is all to common in our day and age, you want someone in your corner. River was so fantastic and they held both or our hands while keeping our birth plan in place. Highly Recommend!

title: Cox Auto Service
comment: Honest, Efficent, never as good could be found since Click and Clack

title: The Local Barber & Tap
comment: I get my hair cut here every two months. Drink a beer, get a shave, and share in an age old preening event.
